website_summaries.verdict: The QuietComfort 25 model takes Bose's already stellar noise-canceling headphones and levels them up to new heights.
pros: highly effective noise-canceling circuitry that's been slightly improved
new folding design allows the headphones to fit in a smaller carrying case
if the battery dies, the music now doesn't die

customer_reviews.title: When I received the product it was amazing, sounded just as I expected
customer_reviews.text: When I received the product it was amazing, sounded just as I expected. Within a couple months the left side of the headphones started giving trouble and eventually stopped working. When I contacted Bose they sent me a replacement but within a month the same problem occurred. When I contacted them and informed them about the issue they said that there was nothing they could do. I am very disappointed by the quality assurance and their customer service. I will not recommend anyone buy this product or any of their others.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Started not to work after 6 months...
customer_reviews.text: After several months, the noise cancelling aspect started fading in and out when turned on. Very disappointing as this was the reason I bought these and believed the "as new" description for the pair I bought. Also, even when working the noise cancelling is not consistently high quality. Good for air conditioning noise but not so great for planes for example. Rather disappointing given the price. And in talking to repair person was told that it wasn't worth the price of fixing and I should just buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hemphill

customer_reviews.title: There is a defect. In 2 out of 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: There is a defect. In 2 out of 3 pairs I own, the right speaker died. This is a very common problem, if you do a google search you will see it.
customer_reviews.author: Soc entrep

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality and noise-cancelling features were superb while they lasted. Then the right cup failed: I tried replacing the battery, replacing the cable, but couldn't get them to work again. Then I read the one-star comments: almost all were about the one-cup failure. Clearly there is a design flaw here.
customer_reviews.author: Sophie Glazer

customer_reviews.title: Right headphone gave out in less than two years. ...
customer_reviews.text: Right headphone gave out in less than two years. Very carefully handled and it gave out randomly. Very disappointing first experience with a Bose product.
customer_reviews.author: David Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Stops Working If You Forget To Turn It Off!!
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working after 1.5 years. I forgot to turn it off, and the next morning (as expected) it had no power, but when I replaced the battery it still didn't work. I took it to a Bose dealer, and they fiddled with it, cleaned the battery terminals which didn't help, then said the circuitry was fried. They said if you leave it on, as the battery gets weaker and weaker it can damage the unit so it won't work Can you believe that!! What a piece of expensive junk, almost cost me $300. Oh, they also said it wasn't worth repairing, and would be cheaper to buy a new one. I'll never buy a Bose product again!!
customer_reviews.author: J. Kuehnis

customer_reviews.title: Left ear stopped functioning after 23 months.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in March 2015 and the left ear speaker/noise cancellation stopped functioning. Bose only provides warranties for one year so there is no recourse other than purchasing a "discounted" replacement for the same model for seventy five dollars less. Have no confidence that a same model replacement will be more reliable/robust. If Bose wanted to create a better customer service approach they would allow for replacement with a different model.
customer_reviews.author: waveseeker

customer_reviews.title: Defective Cushions
customer_reviews.text: The ear cushions are defective. The leatherette covering the foam in the cushions came off twice. The first time I bought a pair from amazon, the second time I contacted Bose and they sent me a free replacement pair. The headphones are only used at home (2-3 hours a day) and they're placed on a headphone stand while not being used. Bose needs to recall these headphones and come up with a permanent solution for the cushions.
customer_reviews.author: ardook

customer_reviews.title: Very effective cancelling noise, especially on airplanes
customer_reviews.text: Finally purchased these headphones when they were on sale--I had been looking at these, because I did not want bluetooth wireless to avoid having to charge an additional item while traveling. I finally had a chance to try them on an airplane, which was my intended use. It was amazing how much noise these headphones cancelled out, and I was able to watch a movie and listen to music at a normal volume. I also didn't have to worry about someone else hearing noise from my headphones--very happy with this purchase. Based on other reviewers' inputs, I did purchase the additional, Square Trade protection plan just in case I need it.
customer_reviews.author: TexasEx

customer_reviews.title: Left Ear Does Not Work - Frequently Reported Problem
customer_reviews.text: My headphones broke pretty quickly. The left ear stopped working completely. Upon searching the internet for ways to fix it, I found this is a common problem with this headset. For $300, I expected these to be something I had for 10+ years. Extremely disappointed in the quality of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Roberta Miller

customer_reviews.title: Right speaker died after one hour. Looked on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Right speaker died after one hour. Looked on the internet and this is a big problem that Bose has not addressed.
customer_reviews.author: lydiamaz

customer_reviews.title: I bought these direct from supplier and they were wonderful. Bought these via Amazon and they dont work ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazon keeps blocking my negative reviews. I think that says it all. I bought these direct from supplier and they were wonderful. Bought these via Amazon and they dont work at all. Not real...
customer_reviews.author: Michael Coffey

customer_reviews.title: Right ear not working..
customer_reviews.text: Bought new one in thanks giving.. but sad to write, right side ear is not working at all. Other thing found that jack is loose and have connection issue . I am very disappointed with sub quality product..This was my first ever bose product and I am deeply disappointed. Reached out to bose support as well but got very generic response to verify battery and connection etc...
customer_reviews.author: Priyank

customer_reviews.title: Deserves a zero
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working pretty much the day the warranty expired. For $279, that's some BS. Still looking for a solution. Thanks a lot, Bose!
customer_reviews.author: Barbra Baker

customer_reviews.title: I believe they would have gone bad much sooner had I used them more often
customer_reviews.text: Had these for almost 4 years before the left side went out. I seldom used these headphones. I believe they would have gone bad much sooner had I used them more often. I was expecting a much longer life considering I have not used them much. This is unacceptable considering the price tag of over $300 when I bought them. They still look brand new but will be going to the trash.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Quite a great - except lack of wireless support
customer_reviews.text: This is quite a great headphone. Large ear pads are good for glasses-wearing person like me. Only one flaw of this product is not a wireless. So, instead of waiting BOSE's new wireless noise-canceling headphone I attachedto my QC25 using. It works very well. Fabulous. This is QC25 should be. Hope BOSE will deliver more beautiful implementation.
customer_reviews.author: inuro

customer_reviews.title: Expensive, but worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: I've purchased various cheapo noise cancelling headphones over the years, now regretting it. I'm a bargain hunter and really want to get "value" for my money. i.e. I'm cheap and proud of it. Tried a friend's Bose headset a couple of months ago and realized what I had been missing. Saw them on sale for $179 and decided enough was enough. Bought it without a moments hesitation, ok, may be a couple of seconds worth. Got it in the mail and yes indeed, the noise cancellation is **really good**. Sad I wasted all that money on the cheap ones that didn't work worth a darn.
customer_reviews.author: TV

customer_reviews.title: They only last a year..
customer_reviews.text: .. search online you'll see lots of people say so. My second pair. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: They sound great when they work but when I purchased a $300 ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in July of 2015 and as of April 2017 after around 20 uses while traveling the right speaker started working intermittently. A quick google search revealed its a very common issue going back to the QC15s. They sound great when they work but when I purchased a $300 pair of,headphones I expect them to last. My first BOSE product and will most likely be my last. 1 year warranty that doesn't even cover shipping if you have to send them back. If you purchase these by them somewhere that you can get an extended warranty because you will need it.
customer_reviews.author: FLJack

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few days
customer_reviews.text: As many others have mentioned, the noise cancelling function MALfunctioned after just a few days of light use. Planning to call customer service this week and hopefully get it straightened out. When buying a high-quality product like this, I would expect a better out-of-the-box experience.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Brewer

customer_reviews.title: Jack to small, unable to use normally.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones work well as you would expect from Bose but the socket for the jack is too small for a normal 3.5mm cable (it's the newer 2.5mm). This is an incredibly stupid and maddening design decision. It always amazes me how smart companies can do such dumb things. If you lose or damage the cable, you now have to hunt (and pay a higher price) for a cable that will fit it. In case anyone is wondering, you can buy ahere on Amazon. 2 stars off for poor design.
customer_reviews.author: Tiki Cat

customer_reviews.title: Not good enough for the price...
customer_reviews.text: It was perfect product when i bought it. Got this product to be used in my office. Initially it worked perfectly and it was all i wanted. noise cancellation was good enough. But problems started in sometime... In 6months: After 6 months there problem with the jack. At times the left speaker will not work and i would have to rotate the jack and set it at some perfect angle to make both speakers work. In 1year: The jack broke. And it is not usable. For this price I would expect good quality which this product fails to meet.
customer_reviews.author: Ashok Kumar Muthusamy

customer_reviews.title: Top Quality Noise Canceling Sorcery!
customer_reviews.text: This is probably one of the BEST items I have ever purchased in my life. I used it on an airline flight after I got it, put on the noise canceling button and thought that there was sorcery in play! I literally could not hear a thing on the plane! I then played music and listened to some sermons and it was , and still is, such a great experience each and every time I use them. Buy them! You will thank me!
customer_reviews.author: HTB webbi

customer_reviews.title: Oh, so quiet!
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts about how well this would work, but much to my surprise it exceeded my expectations. Once I turned it on the plain ride was peacefully quiet. It was a long flight but the ear phone remained comfortable. It worked so well I bought a pair for a friend who is bothered by external noise. Now he is blissfully pleased that her can work and travel in silence.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Noise-Cancelling, Faulty Connection
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd pair of Bose headphones I've gone through. I bought the newest model and returned because the Bluetooth connection was bad across devices even using their software. This pair I thought would fare better with wired connection as a fail-safe, but within about 6 months the right earcup has a faulty connection, outside of warranty of course. Never using Bose again; would not recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel R

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a short time of very gentle use
customer_reviews.text: These headphones broke very easily. The right ear cup doesn't work. This happened after a few months of very gentle and very occasional use. I always transported the headphones in their case and only wore them when I was sitting still at a computer, and I wore them maybe once a week at most. As gently as they were used, there's no reason why they should've broken as quickly as they did. I wish I could have my 300 dollars back. What a waste of money. This is the most disappointing purchase I've made in many years. I won't be buying Bose products again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Baumann

customer_reviews.title: Bad headphones, bad return process
customer_reviews.text: Right headphone stopped working minutes out of the box which apparently is a known issue with these headphones. The return process took over a week and though I requested a different pair they simply gave me a refund. I took this as a sign to try buying a pair of NC headphones from a different brand as that's too many failures on their part to try again.
customer_reviews.author: L B

customer_reviews.title: Cheap construction that often breaks in a year to 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Cheap construction that often breaks in a year to 18 months. Check the web for pervasive known problem with losing all sound and noise cancellation in one or both sides. What is Bose response...sorry about that...we will gladly sell you another pair for $225 dollars. So much for the so called legendary Bose service. My advice...Look to other brands. I have, after buying Bose products for 25 years...NO MORE. [...]
customer_reviews.author: richh

customer_reviews.title: This is very troubling as the headset (a christmas gift) ...
customer_reviews.text: This is very troubling as the headset (a christmas gift) did not work at all. There seems to be a problem with the connector where the cord (separate) plugs into the headset, it either gives sound only out of one ear, or none at all. It was static and then no sound. I would guess this is a manufacturing problem, and give what I have just read from other reviews (wish I would have read more when I bought them) this is a common problem. I will see what Amazon can do for me.
customer_reviews.author: jlp3006

customer_reviews.title: My previously pair lasted like 12-13 years
customer_reviews.text: Right side didn't work straight out of the box. My previously pair lasted like 12-13 years. So much for an upgrade. I've gone back to the QuietComfort 15, but I don't have high hopes they will be as good as my originals. I guess there isn't as much money in making a quality product that lasts, everything is engineered to fail so it can be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: (used to) Love them - they lasted 13 months
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable to wear and blocks noise better than foam earplugs or any other headphones I've tried. It's not an inconvenience for me to have to plug them into the music source because I'm always sitting still when I use them, and I didn't want to pay so much more for a feature I didn't need. But I am so happy with them, the quality of the sound is amazing. I've had them for two months, used them for several hours a day, and love them. One month after the warranty expired, they expired. Too much money to spend on a product that dies in month 13.
customer_reviews.author: AMQCS

customer_reviews.title: Dead on Arrival and support/warranty has not helped.
customer_reviews.text: The headphones lasted a whole DAY. After the first 4-5 hours of use, the noise cancelling completely broke. Changing batteries didn't fix it, switching to different videos didn't work, and so, I contacted BOSE support. Oh boy was buying this a mistake, the Bose support has been an absolute nightmare. I just want my headphones to actually work so I don't get migraines at work. STAY AWAY from this product. Extremely disappointed considering how expensive this product is.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Customer Service OK product Engineered to fail
customer_reviews.text: Purchased September 2016. Driver on left speaker failed December 2017. Headphones were barely ever used. Bose warranty refused to cover replacement, or supply replacement speakers for repair. At this price point one would expect better customer service and better servicability. Sound is adequate, and noise cancellation was underwhelming. Most of noise cancellation was due to the padding on the headphones rather than active cancellation. have bought three of these for friends/ family (mostly due to bose's marketing cache factor)
customer_reviews.author: Real Deal

customer_reviews.title: Not what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. This is my second pair of Bose Quiet-comfort 25 headphones. The first pair was used minimally on airplanes or while walking. They lasted about 3 years before the started producing a static sound and then no sound at all on the right side. The noise canceling was significant - I could not hear people talking around me. This pair has not produced clear sound at all (always a bit of static) and the noise cancelling is not effective at all. I have found myself turning them off and on, just to see if they are indeed turned on, because I can hear everyone and everything around me. Very disappointing for the brand and the price. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Loz1217

customer_reviews.title: The connection between the headphone and cable is flaky!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised and deeply disappointed by the fact that the quality control is extremely bad. The connection form the cable to the headphone is so flaky from the moment I got the item. I never expect this kind of thing would happen to a Bose product. Even when I just slightly move my head or barely touch the cable, the headphone becomes inaudible. I literally have to return it back the moment I just received this product and this is the first time I left a negative comment on a product sold by Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely get the extended warranty
customer_reviews.text: Left speaker stopped working one year and a week after purchase date. Called them up and told them since I didn't open it for a week (it was a gift), really it was within one year. Luckily they replaced it. Always treated them gently, but wore them in bed and the pressure of my head on the earmuff must have broke it.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Stahlke

customer_reviews.title: Expensive headphone that won't work more than a year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for long frilghts; however, I used them every day at the office and at home. I can say that they are very comfortable headphones for long wear and that the sound is great. Additionally, the noise canceling feature works great. Nonetheless, they are headphones that didn't last over the year and considering how expensive they are I think that's completely unacceptable. I'm switching to Sony and see how that works out cause the worse part is, Bose's customer service sucks and they won't do anything about it.
customer_reviews.author: Johanna González

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.  Get em.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic headphones. Sound quality is outstanding and I couldn't be happier with the purchase. My only concern is what others have stated about the headphone build quality especially surrounding the ear cups. You can easily see that small wire that attaches each one, and with repeated use many people have complained about the loss of sound altogether. I ended up purchasing the additional warranty so hopefully that will cover any issue that may arise from it. I really hope they don't go bad like many others - because coupled with the AirMod Wireless Bluetooth Adapter, these things are right on par with the more expensive QC35's.
customer_reviews.author: An Honest Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Quieter on the Plane
customer_reviews.text: These are my third set of noise cancelling headsets, and the best so far. I could not bring myself to pay full price, and when the price finally dropped about the time I had a half-dozen plane flights coming up, I got some. Definitely BETTER noise reduction. Comfortable to wear for 5-6 hours. The one ANNOYING thing is the audio cable is not "standard". It's smaller. So, if anything ever happens to the cable (like gets left on the plane of cut somehow), you can't just pop down to the store and get a new one. NOBODY carries this size in a store. And, they cost more. I am really glad I bought these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Dick B.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic headphones
customer_reviews.text: The QC25s are fantastic for two reasons: 1. It's wired, so you don't have to worry about spotty bluetooth connections 2. It takes AAA batteries, so you don't have to worry about a lithium-ion battery's charge cycles depleting future battery capacity I really wish Bose still sold headphones with AAA batteries in this day and age, but I guess we're rapidly approaching a consumeristic society where things like $3-400 headphones are considered temporary...
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: Right ear cutting in and out. This is same problem that others are having. Bose answer is to sell replacement unit for $225. Bose is aware of manufacturing problem but wants me to buy new one to replace their defective product. Buyers beware! Mine going in trash and never buy Bose again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quiet at last
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the music and screaming trainers in class at my YMCA were painful. I checked the sound levels in the gym and they were at a dangerous level. Complaints did nothing and I couldn't stand it. These noise-cancelling headphones have made my workout very pleasant. I can still hear the sounds, but they are VERY muted.
customer_reviews.author: WylieWabbit

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed. I brought these into work and they never ...
customer_reviews.text: After 13 months, one headphone suddenly stopped producing sound. The warranty only covers repairs for 12 months. I effectively got one year of use out of a $300 product. I'm very, very disappointed. I brought these into work and they never left my desk, so it's not like they were subjected to any extreme use. In its stead, I've been using a Razer Chroma headset I bought for gaming at home. The saddest part is that this headset, which costs half the price, sounds better than the Bose headphones ever did.
customer_reviews.author: eman nep

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fr long flights
customer_reviews.text: This year I have been taking frequent long flights. I purchased some less expensive noise cancelling headphones late last year and found them to be very uncomfortable three hours into the flight and would take them of and put in my ear buds.. I have found these to be very comfortable over an eight hour flight. The noise cancelling is sufficient and I even wear them when mowing the lawn. I find the sound quality to be good, but I am usually listening to audio books and pod casts. They pack nicely and overall are a great value.
customer_reviews.author: Alex S. Barnicott

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE HEADSET
customer_reviews.text: I feel like I was boon-doggled on this purchase...I spent over $358 on these and the first time I used them was a terrible experience. I bought them for christmas gifts for my husband and myself and I just used them for the first time on an international flight. Any time I moved (or didn't) the cord would come apart from the headset losing all sound. So i had to hold the cord in place while I wanted to hear the movie/music. I'm so upset because the date to exchange/return has passed...I have one headset never used and another one that will not be used again. This was a terrible purchase.
customer_reviews.author: andrea

customer_reviews.title: Worked for about a dozen uses only
customer_reviews.text: I was ecstatic that my husband surprised me with these headphones, as I'd rarely purchase a premium product for myself. I've used them about 12 times in my home office. I've never mistreated them or even took them out of my home in the couple months I've had them. They were stored carefully after each use, in the provided container. Unfortunately, they already stopped working. I will update after contacting customer service. So, so disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: BookNerd

customer_reviews.title: it worked very fine but I started hearing a clicking sound from the ...
customer_reviews.text: At the 1st I got the headset, it worked very fine but I started hearing a clicking sound from the 2nd day while noise cancellation is on . It seems to be related to a faulty connection because it tends to happen when I move my head very slightly. May be not. Sometimes, I feel like it is just a random behavior, not related to a faulty connection. I am not sure whether I should contact Amazon or Bose for replacement or Product Support.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would not work for person who has sensitive ears
customer_reviews.text: Noise-canceling (NC) feature was not worked well for me.I experienced a headache and nausea every time using QC25. Thought a headache and nausea only temporary and my ears would adjust to NC. But after three days it was getting worse and couldn't stand it anymore. Googled info about NC and found out not everyone can use NC due to sensitive ears. This may be a good headphone as it has active isolation but not for everybody. Very fortunate I bought it from Amazon and returned it after 3 days. Now, I'm looking passive isolation headphone and it may work better for me.
customer_reviews.author: whisnu

customer_reviews.title: Questionable Manufacturing Quality
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working on one of the ear after 18 months. Bad manufacturing quality for a pricy headphone and this issue is reported by multiple people.
customer_reviews.author: Pirai soodan

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancellation, stellar sound and bass. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Great clarity and sound overall. Noise cancellation is a stellar experience. Very comfortable when fitted around the ears and keeps the sound moving along. Crisp, yet a brilliant masterpiece in technology. Worth every penny. UPDATE: Tried these bad boys on while on a flight from CA to the US, and they did wonders. They really make the background disappear and allow you to be immersed into the music. It felt surreal and very different and in a much more pleasant mood overall. These work great to block out humans in general.
customer_reviews.author: Biscuit89

customer_reviews.title: Great all around
customer_reviews.text: The noise cancellation on these headphones is fantastic. I don't like hearing any noise when I sleep, and with these I can listen to a podcast or audiobook and block out any loud video game/movie noises from the rest of my house. However, the noise cancellation does go through AAA batteries fairly quickly. If you accidentally leave the NC switch on for a few hours, it will use up a whole battery. The headphones are comfortable but a bit big for me. Even so, they fit well and I havent experienced any problems with them in that regard. The sound quality is quite good, though the bass is weaker than I would like. Overall, I am very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: You win some you lose some
customer_reviews.text: My coworker is extremely loud in everything they do. Rather than continue my slow spiral into insanity, I purchased these headphones. These are great for ambient office sounds like fans, ac/heat running, mouse clicking, keyboard sounds, office chair sounds etc. They don't cancel out conversations, coughing, sneezing etc although it does mute them some. To my endless relief they cancel out loud chewing sounds. Specifically sunflower seeds. And general mouth sounds. Like slurping coffee. The sound quality is pretty average, my old headphones were Skull Candy brand and the sound quality was definitely better than these Bose. But I was more concerned about cancelling sound than I was for overall sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tam

customer_reviews.title: Noise cancelling stopped working after a couple of months of use.
customer_reviews.text: They worked like magic when I just got them. It was pretty amazing how well they cancelled the noise. But after a couple of months of light use I ran into the same problem that other users reported. The noise cancelling feature keeps turning on and off. I thought the battery died, but a new battery didn't help. I don't even turn on the noise cancelling and use them as regular headphones. It's upsetting because they are not cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for travel
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband for his birthday last year. He had previously had a set of these and love them but they were old and he needed to upgrade his pair. He travels a lot for work so this seems like a good investment. He absolutely loves these and will not leave on a trip without them. They cancel out the sound on planes and allow him to either listen to what he wants to or to rest comfortably which is very valuable when you travel for work as much as he does. They were a great birthday gift and he enjoys them regularly. They are a great brand and I highly recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are absolutely amazing! Good points: with constant sounds the noise filter turns the sound off. I have had many headphones with good noise filters, but none even approach this ability. “Bad” point: Technology at this point is unable to completely filter varying sounds like speech. These headphones still do a creditable job even here. Note: These require (1) AAA battery. I consider this a Good point, because I can swap out the battery and the headphones instantly work again. Also, I don’t have to fiddle with power adapters when traveling to foreign countries.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Zero stars is not an option
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a 9 hour flight and the product did not work straight out of the package. The right side earphone did not work at all, and the left side would go out if I moved in the slightest. Low quality.
customer_reviews.author: M Neuman

customer_reviews.title: I use them to wear while watching TV on an elliptical in my home so as not wake anyone up (I like to ride early in morning or la
customer_reviews.text: If you plan to use these during any kind of motion, know that the cord that fits into the headset wiggles and creates noise audible while in use. I use them while watching TV on an elliptical in my home so as not wake anyone up (I like to ride early in morning or late at night). After a few months of use, I began to constantly hear in the left ear the dang loose connection as well as a thump cord transmitted along the cord. I have to sit perfectly still not to hear this extra noise. You would think something as expensive as this would have a little better connector and cord quality.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Argyle Woodruff

customer_reviews.title: Has Bose lost their mojo or is this a Chinese Knockoff?
customer_reviews.text: Construction: Sounds fine when the 2.5mm jack doesn't lose a channel from being too lose. Terrible tolerances between the 2.5mm male jack and female receptacle is pretty bad on mine. The head band fits nicely, but also feels flimsy, sit on them once and they'll probably come apart. Sound: The noise canceling is great. The sound is good when the noise canceling is on, but when it's off everything sounds a little hollow. Obviously there will be a difference with background noise, but it's not up to par for a > $200 pair of headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan H.

customer_reviews.title: Known Defect that Bose Ignores
customer_reviews.text: Many of these have a known defect: the right ear stops working. This doesn't appear immediately, so Bose refuses to do anything about it. Don't buy these.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabett A Hillery

customer_reviews.title: QC should stand for Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: On my first pair, no audio came out of the right speaker. I called Bose and they determined the headset was defective. My replacement pair (brand new from Amazon, not a refurb from Bose) had the exact same problem. I then googled "Bose qc25 one speaker not working" and found pages of results from people with the same issue. Some claim the issue was resolved after 2015, but both of my pairs were purchased in 2017. Sadly, I'm going to have to look for a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Brueck

customer_reviews.title: Great noise canceling headphones
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pair each for my wife and me for a transatlantic flight when Amazon had them priced at $129. The noise cancelation worked very well and the sound was very good. One could barely notice a slight background hiss in lieu of the engines' loud droning. Watching and listening to in-flight entertainment was very pleasant and almost engaging. Phones were very comfortable for 10 hours. We've used Bose QC20's before and the background hiss was a litle more noticeable on the 20's, to my ears. All in all, a great tool for air travelers.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just as good as QC35, but without the price.
customer_reviews.text: Still a great buy for the price! I did not need wireless bluetooth connectivity and did not care for Google Assistant so Bose QC 35s had a lot of unneeded features for a much higher price. These QC25 offer the same comfort fit and noise canceling. My main reason for purchasing these was long distance air travel. If wireless is important to you, of course go with the QC35. But remember, the QC25 offer similar performance for much cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: EDC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for ADHD
customer_reviews.text: You can work anywhere if you plug these into a low-volume white noise recording, on top of their noise-cancellation abilities. I love them!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan D.

customer_reviews.title: AAA Bateries Are Actually a Good Thing
customer_reviews.text: The noise canceling on Bose headphones is best-in-class. If you intend on owning something for a long time, a rechargeable battery is going to be a real point of worry in terms of longevity, as they are able to hold less and less of a charge with age. Being able to swap out the battery alleviates this problem. The comfort and noise canceling of these QuietComfort 25’s are on par with the newer QC 35‘s. This is the pair to buy if wireless audio isn’t a concern, since these cost over $100 less than the QC 35’s.
customer_reviews.author: J. E. Rose

customer_reviews.title: No sound from Right Headphone
customer_reviews.text: I have ordered twice from Amazon; both times the right headphone is not producing sound. So disappointed; the sound from the one headphone is excellent and the travel size is the best. Unfortunately, I will be returning again. I read reviews stating that this happened often, but could not believe that this of such a quality company as Bose. If you order, hope your luck is better.
customer_reviews.author: CocoMonet

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I can barely hear these things. It's really sad what's happened to this company they used to be the best but now you can get $50 headphones that are twice as good as these. I switch back to my Sonys. These headphones are so bad I've actually consider trying to get my money back for them. Seriously Dollar store headphones are better have more Bass and treble quality you're better off with going with JVC Skullcandy or Sony. Totally something I did not expect with a Bose logo. Which is the only thing you're buying purchasing these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon McClain

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 11 Months
customer_reviews.text: Went to change batteries after a clicking sound let me know it was time. Turned them off, replaced the battery and they wont turn on. I guess the switch went bad. I will not recommend Bose any more as they obviously have gone to cheap parts for their products. Update: Contacted Bose for warranty replacement on May 18 2020. They asked me to send them the proof that these were purchased from an approved vendor. Sent the proof the same day and still no contact from Bose. It's been 2 months since I sent them an email (twice) and still nothing. Service is the worst I've seen. I will never buy a Bose product again.
customer_reviews.author: Grendal

customer_reviews.title: Sound great...broke after 1 minute
customer_reviews.text: I received these and they broke within 1 minute. For that minute, they sounded great and noise cancelled very well. However, the connector into the headphone would cause the ear phones to cut in and out when you touched or turned them. I hope this is not an indication of the quality. I have sought a replacement from Amazon and will let you know of my new review based on the new pair.
customer_reviews.author: Range

customer_reviews.title: Major disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I don't mind paying big bucks for a quality product from a company that has a good reputation. These headphones are not worthy of the name BOSE. The electrical circuitry either has cheap material or has a bad design flaw. The connection to the left ear must be constantly repositioned to bring sound to both ears. When the first set failed after 10 hours of use, I returned it to Amazon. They replaced it quickly with another set. Now this one also has the same problem with the connection after just 10 hours of use. Don't buy it, you'll be sorry you did.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Beringer

customer_reviews.title: Expected better quality from Bose
customer_reviews.text: The 3.5mm audio jack actually snapped apart randomly around the middle of the plug. Quite disappointed. Headphones rendered useless within a week of getting them. I expected better quality out of Bose. Would love the product to be replaced. The headphones are great but the materials are questionable for the wire jack plug.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: the head phones are great as always
customer_reviews.text: Beware, the head phones are great as always, but the wire Jack connection is a factory design flaw that needs to be corrected. Bucause of the loose Jack connection the sound only works in the right ear then the left ear then both then no sound at all you must constantly move the Jack connection to receive proper sound I tried two sets to make sure factory defect. I have worked in component level repair for three or four major company's 25 to 30 years went to school at devry Dallas. Bose should be ashamed of them selfs for this one. To muck money for a defect like that don't buy until they fix the problem easy fix for company.
customer_reviews.author: Kh

customer_reviews.title: Never Again Bose
customer_reviews.text: Look at the one star reviews - are you willing to pay hundreds of dollars for something that has a 10% chance of failure? I loved these and used them daily at work until the left speaker stopped worked approximately 5 days after the warranty ended. A web search revealed that this has been happening to many people for a long time, but Bose apparently is not interested in fixing the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Rose Stenglein

customer_reviews.title: Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered Bose QuietComfort 25 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones within 2 months the ear pads started falling apart. Reached out to seller & was informed this is a "refurbed" item and not new. Description on sales page for the headphones said nothing about refurbed. Contacted seller and was told they have no replacement pads in stalk but would send some out in 2-3 weeks if i gave a good review. Do not purchase from trustedseller3928. Also this is a known issue apparently that is in the reviews that I did not see prior to purchase. Better off purchasing something newer.
customer_reviews.author: kman1978

customer_reviews.title: Great until they break- and squaretrade protection won't be useful
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these headphones in Dec of 2017. As with many other reviews, the headphones were great until they were not. After reading the reviews, I purchased the squaretrade protection plan to try to protect this investment. Two years after purchase, the battery box must be pressed in to power on, it is an intermittent issue. Today I was told by squaretrade that they do not cover intermittent issues. No way to win here. This model is flawed.
customer_reviews.author: A S

customer_reviews.title: Incredible sound and noise-cancelling!
customer_reviews.text: These are so great! I’ve had a pair of Sony’s for years and thought they were great, but this quality of both sound and noise-cancelling is night and day. I love that I can wear them by themselves or plug them in. I don’t do well with Bluetooth, so I prefer wired, and the adapter to use with my phone works incredibly well, even for calls while I’m walking down loud, NYC streets. I never have trouble with the cord answer-volume control button either, where my Sony one never worked. I work in a place that plays loud music at times and these are a Godsend!
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Great noise canceling, meh sound
customer_reviews.text: I resisted getting noise canceling headphones for work, since I hate it when people sneak up on me. But when people decided that playing music on speakers is acceptable, I needed to be able to block it out. - I have a small head. These are comfortable enough for long sessions, but they're not my HyperX Cloud. - Sound is shit if you don't turn on the noise canceling. It's meh if you do. - I find that I will get a headache if the noise canceling is on but nothing is playing. Sometimes I just need quiet :-/ - Invest in rechargeable batteries, you'll need them
customer_reviews.author: LeahTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Got these before a 14 hour flight to Asia. These were a lifesaver for long flights. Just plugged it into the airline music entertainment system the music was good and it defiantly helped with the plane noise. When I turned off the music the noise cancelling worked great. Even on shorter flights very helpful with crying screaming babies. You can still hear the screaming but nothing like with the headphones. Don’t think I will ever travel by plane without these headphones.
customer_reviews.author: cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Great performance at a great price
customer_reviews.text: We bought two of the Bose QuietComfort 25 wired headphones for our flights to and from Italy. They were awesome! The noise cancellation was excellent. We actually got some sleep in. I plugged into the plane entertainment system while my wife used her iPad with downloaded Netflix videos. The sound quality and control is very good. We have since used these during 5-hour train trips as well. After 3 months we are very happy with these headphones. Bose had recently stopped selling this model on its web site resulting in an excellent price on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick W.

customer_reviews.title: These amazing reviews motivated me to buy this headphone but I ...
customer_reviews.text: DON'T BUY!!!! My husband wanted one Bose headphone since a long time and I thought to surprise him with one for new year! These amazing reviews motivated me to buy this headphone but I was totally disappointed after reeving this headphone. It was working only one side. I was so frustrated that how can a reputed company like BOSE can dispatch an item without proper testing the product. VERY DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.author: Riya

customer_reviews.title: worked for 12-14 flights, then broke.
customer_reviews.text: ordered this early may, 2018. it is now 18 months later and i'm throwing them away. they were fine while they worked, compact, effective. on a flight 3 days ago the headphones started cutting out- losing noise cancellation and even sound [usually will provide sound even when turned off]. off and on. off and on. thought it was the battery. new battery => same thing. they were not used all that often- 8-10 flights per year. so i got to use these around 12-14 times before they broke. i will not buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Klugman

customer_reviews.title: Problems with sound within 2 months of use
customer_reviews.text: Really cool headphones. Work amazing when they work, but less than 2 months after purchase the plug-in wire is already malfunctioning and sound is intermittent. I had to return but only got a partial refund because I was past the 30 day refund window. Buyer beware. This is a problem. Too bad I love them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gamechanger
customer_reviews.text: I finally cracked and bought these after a hellish Christmas travel season. Why airports think we need more noise in the form of Christmas carols on top of screaming toddlers, constant redundant announcements, and obnoxious fellow travellers beats me (anyone who thinks it can't be any other way needs a stopover in Oslo to see the light). These were a good deal and work so well that I leave them on until I'm out of the airport. They don't block out everything but enough to make traveling a far less stressful/unpleasant experience.
customer_reviews.author: P. Mimula

customer_reviews.title: A few minutes of silence
customer_reviews.text: I love the cone of silence these provide, and the sound is great for watching movies and TV. My husband is a journalist and keeps stealing them for his phone interviews (yes, they have a mic built in). The reviews all said they are fragile, so I got them on sale and purchased the extended warranty, which still came out much lower than suggested retail. I baby them and tuck them into their little case each night, and I hope they live and long, full life. Money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Burns

customer_reviews.title: I love these! They sound good and the noise cancelling ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these! They sound good and the noise cancelling is second to none. I'm very satisfied! I also picked up this bluetooth adapter, which has made these even better!
customer_reviews.author: Capt'n Burns

customer_reviews.title: Bose - what else do you need to know?
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement set for the ones I gave my wife a year or so ago. Unfortunately she left them on a plane and no one was honest enough to turn them in. She enjoyed them, was satisfied with them the first time around, so there was no guessing about what pair I was going to get. On top of that, I have an older pair/previous model, that I love. Decent price for a great travel/airplane headset.
customer_reviews.author: Michael O'Neil

customer_reviews.title: They Stop Working
customer_reviews.text: Like the countless others here I bought mine in 2014 thinking they are Bose so they are a quality product. They worked and sounded great until today. After 4 or so years of moderate use in my air travels the right side failure issue started today. So disappointing I will try and see how far I get with customer service tomorrow, but I hold little hope of anything. Stay Away from Bose as they do not hold up over time and are not worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very effective at neutralizing airline noise
customer_reviews.text: Although I haven't tried many other brands, I did return two different products before I found these. They are the most effective in neutralizing airline noise and are still capable of transmitting sound quality decent enough to listen to rock, movie dialogue and classical music. I travel internationally so I chose this product which requires AAA batteries rather than an internal system that needs to be recharged since it is one less cord to carry and one less outlet to find in an unfamiliar and sometimes woefully outlet-deficient hotel! If this is your choice make certain to carry extra batteries.
customer_reviews.author: sparkle

customer_reviews.title: Second purchase by a satisfied customer
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was for my wife. I have a pair of my own which I purchased years ago for a significantly higher price, and I am very satisfied with them. I use them every day. In summer, I use them when mowing the yard on my lawn tractor. The noise cancellation feature makes the engine noise barely noticeable. A chore suddenly turned into a pleasant experience. My wife uses an iPad quite a lot, so I thought a pair of Bose QC25 headphones would improve her enjoyment when watching videos or listening to audio books.
customer_reviews.author: R. Magee

customer_reviews.title: A Necessity for Flying
customer_reviews.text: When flying and using in-ear headphones, I found that I had to have the music at full volume which I would never do in every day use. And listening to music or a movie at full volume in addition to the jet noise did not eliminate the tiring effects of the noise on a long flight. The Bose noise cancelling headphones do an excellent job of eliminating the jet noise and allowing me to listen at a volume I like. I wear them for the entire flight even when not listening to music or a movie. The only thing wrong with these is the AAA battery.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: They kind of work. But too many things wrong with them. Not worth $300.
customer_reviews.text: While they work, the quality level is subpar — especially for the price. The cord that connects to the earphones is finicky and sensitive, which means if it's not perfectly connected, you only get sound in your left ear. Next, the metal logos are already starting to face and chip, even when I've barely used the earphones. They're only 1 week old! Next, the stitching in the case is coming undone. Basically, a lot things about this product make me feel like I got ripped off. For $300, I expected higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Failed at two years
customer_reviews.text: I bought Bose QC 25 two years ago. They worked OK until recently when sound suddenly disappeared from R ear. Tried changing the cable, but that didn't help, so malfunction is in the headphones themselves. Very disappointing that such an expensive product from a previously respected name brand would fail in two years. Before they failed, the noise canceling was OK but did not wow me. Just purchased a set of Noontec Hammo Go Active noise canceling headphones for a fraction of price of the Bose. Will be interesting to see how these compare.
customer_reviews.author: Maharaj

customer_reviews.title: So long noise!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. If you are a Boze lover...these are your headphones. I hate back noise...and these never let me down. I go to my quiet music spot for meditation, watch Netflix, and Rock out with Heavy Metel. Sound is always stable. It pairs easy to multiple wireless electronics. I have an iphone, ipad, airbook, and my car radio -- the headset remembers the electronic devices without needing to pair again. Battery holds charge for lots of time (I have gone at least 20 hours on same battery) and a voice tells you how much headset is charged. I wear them for hours and they stay comfortable. Awesome on planes. The only negative is the carrier box. Zipper broke in one day.
customer_reviews.author: Dena Peacock

customer_reviews.title: Great Headphones with Questionable Marketing and Pricing
customer_reviews.text: These headphones are comfortable to wear, they sound great, and they do a good job of reducing ambient noise. I would recommend them to anyone. But I don't understand why Bose/Amazon price the "Android version" higher than the "Apple device version". These headphones, either version, use a 3.5-mm plug. That's a standard used in both iPhones and Android phones. So, what's the difference? I use the less expensive "Apple device version" with a Samsung phone - have been for years.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Apple

customer_reviews.title: A must for any traveler!
customer_reviews.text: These headphones offer the best quality in noise cancellation out there. I purchased these as a gift for my wife to use when we travel. The speakers offer a pretty balanced sound quality and drown out unwanted noise from the outside world. Screaming babies, airplane engines and general background noise is considerably reduced even if no music is playing. You can also get up to 16+hrs worth of battery life out of them. The travle case is durable and offer a small spot for a spare AAA battery. Perfect for travel or use in public areas. Incredibly comfortable ear cups that offer hours of enjoyment.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: best sound and best noise cancelling
customer_reviews.text: i love bose quiet comfort. i owned my last qc15 until they fell apart. will do the same with these. i always have them with me for every trip. the ear pads are replaceable and can be purchased here in amazon. the noise cancelling in these is astounding. the silence is unparalleled and the sound quality of bose will make you listen to your entire music library in a whole new way. You will find that your favorite song has instruments and beats you had never noticed before. quality batteries last a few days. every 5 years i am happy to spend $300 on QC Bose headphones.
customer_reviews.author: VC

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing counterfeit product
customer_reviews.text: This item was broken when it arrived. The sound quality is shocking and sounds like the speaker drivers have blown. I replaced the drivers but still the sound is shocking. It is too expensive and inconvenient to send back to USA so I have to try to fix the problem myself. I sincerely doubt that this product was new. I am extremely disappointed. I have just had this set checked by Bose South Africa and am advised that it is a counterfeit product and therefore cannot be repaired. I am shocked, extremely angry and disappointed with this seller.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too much pressure on top of head
customer_reviews.text: The Bose Quiet Comfort 25 puts a lot of pressure on the top of my head. I returned it for this reason. (I almost NEVER return things but this product was really bad.) My husband has Bose Quiet Comfort 15 which is terrific and puts no pressure on the top of my head. Noise cancelling quality of both the 15 and 25 was comparable. I just reordered the Quiet Comfort 15. I won't even consider ordering the Bose 30 since you can't change the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne C.

customer_reviews.title: My experience with customer service wasn't great with a refund before or a repair on another ...
customer_reviews.text: Not sure I would purchase Bose again. Purchased these on December 1, 2017 and already the volume button isn't working.... Never used it until today. My experience with customer service wasn't great with a refund before or a repair on another set of broken Bose headset....... Wish I had a better experience because it is a nice product........ Just not happy that after one month the volume button doesn't work and these weren't cheap either.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia A. Clark

customer_reviews.title: I stick with these, because I can change the battery and the sound is similar.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of QuietComfort 25's. One I keep in my travel bag, for trips. The other I use around the house and in the garden when moving and such. They provide excellent 'real' audio, not that bass heavy sound that some headphones emphasize. I'm very pleased with them. I was going to go for the QC35, but I really couldn't hear that much of a difference in sound, plus they did not have a replaceable battery. Which is real important when you are on a long plane ride, or just don't remember, how long ago you plugged your headphones into a power outlet.
customer_reviews.author: MiamiOne

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, good noise cancellation
customer_reviews.text: After using regular headphones in the office to try to drown out some of the background noise (unsuccessfully), I invested in a pair of these. The sound quality of these headphones is great, but I was disappointed to find that in an environment with existing white noise, they do a much better job of cancelling out the white noise than conversations, and actually make the noise I'm trying to avoid clearer. While there is a significant improvement over non-noise-cancelling headphones in reduction of background noise, don't buy these expecting a miracle.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

product_meta.title: Bose QuietComfort 25 Acoustic Noise Cancelling Headphones for Apple devices - Black (Wired 3.5mm)
product_meta.description: Color:Black| Style:Apple DevicesQuietComfort 25 Acoustic Noise Cancelling headphones are the best performing around ear headphones from Bose. They give you crisp, powerful sound and quiet that lets you hear your music better. Bose advances their industry leading headphones with the latest proprietary Bose Active EQ and TriPort technology, giving the music you love deep, clear sound. At the same time, Bose noise cancelling technology monitors the noise around you and cancels it out, helping you focus on what you want to hear whether it’s your music, your calls or simply peace and quiet. With a distinctive design and two color options to match your style, these headphones look as good as they sound. They’re also comfortable, durably made and easy to stow, with earcups that pivot to fit in a small carrying case. Customized for Apple devices. Included: QuietComfort 25 headphones; 56 inch QC25 inline remote and microphone cable; airline adapter; carrying case; AAA battery.
feature_bullets: Deep, powerful sound for the music you love
Lightweight, comfortable around ear fit you can wear all day long
Control your music and calls on Apple devices with inline mic/remote

Apple compatible devices Applies to: QC 25 noise cancelling headphones Apple devices The remote and mic are compatible with the following Apple devices: iPhone 3GS or later iPad iPod touch 2nd generation or later iPod classic 120GB, 160GB iPod nano 4th generation or later

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars11,033 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
